name: Puma - Ralph Sampson Lo "Chinatown Market"
description: When it comes to style, designer Mike Cherman creates his own rules. His bootleg aesthetic brand, Chinatown Market, is no different. Inspired by the grit and style of New York’s famous Canal Street, Chinatown Market stands out with daring attitude, fun graphics, and cheeky prints. Influenced by retro basketball, the first iteration of PUMA x CHINATOWN MARKET is meant to have a DIY feel as if it were made and customized by hand.

name: Puma - RS-X Hard Drive
description: Like any good sneaker, these RS-X Hard Drive shoes are geared to help you power through each step. Panels of mesh, textile and rubber swish across the upper, offering breathability and soft visual accents. PUMA's Running System tech is practically the nuts and bolts of the engine, supplying comfort and plush cushioning, and the rubber outsole stops you in an instant. There's a plastic heel tab at the back for easy on and off, while subtle PUMA RS-X and Running System callouts sit on the tongue tab, tongue and heel.

name: Puma - Ralph Sampson Low OG
description: Back in the ‘80s, Ralph Sampson was a basketball legend. First pick of the NBA Draft in ’83, Rookie of the Year in ’84, he towered over the rest of the players and elevated the game to unprecedented heights. Signing Sampson took PUMA to the next level in the basketball world – and in return, we created a customized kick just for him. Enter: the PUMA Ralph Sampson. With a mid-height construction for ankle support and a lightweight design for speed and agility, it was tailored to Sampson’s needs on the court and stamped with his signature at the side.

name: Puma - Thunder Desert
description: The Thunder pays homage to past collabs and silhouettes ahead of their time. Inspired by '90s Cell System running silhouettes and the PUMA x McQueen collaboration, the style is a reimagined pair of kicks with a bulky, unapologetic look and feel. The exaggerated tooling, the blown-up proportions and the loud color blocking reserve a spot for the Thunder on the international runways.

name: Puma - Cell Ultra OG Pack
description: This one’s for those who do the most. CELL Ultra OG comes straight from the ‘90s, adding fresh materials and colorways to the OG model. Retro design and signature PUMA CELL tech makes a comeback in CELL Ultra, with a distinct look borrowed from the past and built for the future.

name: Puma - Puma Inhale
description: PUMA is always looking for ways to maximize energy. In 2000, we launched Inhale, a running shoe with thick soles, exaggerated contours, and a daring material mix. Today we’re breathing new life into this silhouette by reissuing it for the streets. With its signature extreme curves in the midsole and pops of red in the upper, Inhale was designed to keep you on your toes and ready to move.

name: Puma - Puma Women´s Cell Stellar
description: This one is officially for all the ladies in the house. For women who only put their best foot forward. CELL Stellar’s design riffs on the PUMA back catalogs from 1998, pulling design cues from other CELL silhouettes and redesigning them for the streets. Its colorblocked materials and colored CELL tech are geared to stand out and shine.

name: Puma - SF Cell Venom
description: After reworking the Suede silhouette last year, PUMA and Ferrari have reunited for two takes on the Cell Venom sneaker. The sneaker is wrapped in two colorways, one of which recreates Ferrari’s iconic red and white color palette, while the other comes with a black upper offset with yellow and silver detailing.

name: Puma - Thunder Spectra
description: This is Thunder. It takes an unconventional approach to design that breaks focus and commands attention. It’s loud with colorblocking, material mixes, and bright accents. Its lines are inspired by the wildly sweeping clouds and jagged lines of lightning, packing the power of a storm.

name: Adidas - A.R. Trainer W
description: In the '80s, tennis champions triumphed on grass, clay and concrete to garner Grand Slam titles. These shoes take design cues from a 1988 tennis sneaker designed to perform on all surfaces. Made in a mix of textures, these streetwear shoes come in a supple leather upper with textured suede at the toe.

name: Adidas - Continental 80
description: The Continental 80 is an authentic bringback of an indoor sneaker from the '80s. These low-top sneakers are made of smooth leather. They show off a swooping two-tone stripe on the side and a split rubber cupsole.

name: Adidas - Superstar
description: The adidas Superstar sneaker reigns supreme. The fan favorite launched in 1969 and quickly lived up to its name as NBA players laced into the now-famous shell-toe design. These men's shoes come in full grain leather with serrated 3-Stripes and a rubber cupsole.

name: Adidas - Ultraboost "UNDEFEATED"
description: Created with L.A. streetwear brand UNDEFEATED, these shoes put a fresh spin on the Ultraboost runner. They feature a flexible yet supportive adidas Primeknit upper and are cushioned with Boost for an energized feel with every step. An American flag at the heel adds some star-spangled flair.

name: Adidas - FYW S-97 W
description: Adidas Originals celebrates the weird and wonderful style of the late '90s with the FYW S-97. These shoes update the favourite oddball design with a few modern tweaks. Made of a mix of suede and mesh, this women's-only version comes in a neutral triple-nude palette. A chunky but lightweight EVA midsole anchors the look.

name: Adidas - Falcon W
description: The rebellious spirit of the '90s music and fashion world brought bold lines and clashing colors. These shoes capture the flavor of that decade with aggressive, swerving shapes and a mix of soft mesh, leather and suede. The ombré-dyed upper offers a color-fade effect.

name: Adidas - Falcon Women
description: The Falcon takes inspiration from '90s running designs and the carefree, rebellious spirit of the decade. These shoes offer a distinctly '90s look with vibrant colors, iridescent details and a wide, chunky silhouette. The thick EVA midsole is built for comfortable, all-day wear.

name: Adidas - Yung-96
description: Authentic '90s adidas vibes are transformed into a bold, confident look. These shoes put a daring spin on retro running style. The upper is made up of layered mesh and nubuck. A lightweight EVA midsole gives them all-day wearability.

name: Nike - Air Force 1
description: The legend lives on in the Nike Air Force 1 '07, a modern take on the icon that blends classic style and fresh, crisp details.

name: Nike - Women´s Air Force 1 ´07
description: The Nike Air Force 1 '07 Essential takes the classic AF-1 design to the next level with an Air Sole unit for lightweight cushioning. Its soft leather upper features debossed logos, while a solid-rubber outsole optimises traction.

name: Nike - Air Max 2 Light
description: Originally released in 1994, the Nike Air Max2 Light returns as a near-exact replica of the iconic runner with style for the street. Its mesh and synthetic upper, moulded heel and Max Air unit honour the OG, while the soft foam midsole optimises all-day comfort.

name: Nike - Women´s Air Max Tailwind IV
description: The Nike Air Max Tailwind IV gives a new look to the late-90s classic. Max Air units give you comfort and style that last.

name: Nike - Nike Air Ghostracer
description: Designed for speed, stability and comfort, the Nike Air Ghost Racer was a hit 20 years ago—and now it's back in a stitch-for-stitch remake. And though it has all the same features as the original, it might be even better than you remember.

name: Nike - Women´s Air Max 98
description: The Nike Air Max 98 makes its return this year in fine form. Nike’s iconic sneaker is celebrating its 20th anniversary following a brief hiatus. With the Nike Air Max 98 OG Gundam women’s kicking things off, 2018 is going to be a big year. Nike’s Air Max series has garnered a massive cult-following for its ties to the urban streetwear culture, and the emergence of the UK Grime music scene.We last saw the AM98 back in 2016, as the Supreme Air Max 98 collaboration caused a massive stir in the footwear game, selling out in all three colourways.

name: Nike - Air Max 98
description: Nike has enjoyed flipping some of their most classic Air Max models inside-out this summer, and now the Air Max 98 is set to join the Air Max 1 in showing its inner workings. Combining black, grey, and beige, these 98s feature unique details like exposed foam edges, a visible production tag on the tongue, and a soft beige midfoot overlay that hangs loosely over the grey suede mudguard to emphasize the reversed look.

name: Nike - Air Max 90 QS "Python"
description: Ever since its drop in 2002, 'Python' has remained one of the most iconic Air Max 90 colourways to this day. The introduction of a snakeskin pattern and exotic materials on the upper made it highly sought-after for every sneakerhead in the early 2000s. The 2019 'Green Python' colourway pays tribute to the original and represents a new modern edition of the OG drop in 2002.

name: Nike - Air Max 2 Light
description: Originally released in 1994, the Nike Air Max2 Light returns as a near-exact replica of the iconic runner with style for the street. Its mesh and synthetic upper, moulded heel and Max Air unit honour the OG, while the soft foam midsole optimises all-day comfort.

name: Nike - Nike Zoom Vomero 5 SE SP
description: After unexpectedly re-launching via a compelling collaboration with A-COLD-WALL last year, Nike’s Zoom Vomero 5, a running classic from the aughts, is returning this month in three compelling in-line colorways. Following up a duo of tonal releases that dropped at the top of the year, these three Vomeros take a more colorful route than their monochromatic predecessors, using white, black, and grey paneling to great effect. Although each pair offers the same set of accents, the base color is vastly different: there’s a cool grey, a sporty blue, and volt green.

name: Nike - Nike P-6000
description: A mash-up of Pegasus' past, the Nike P-6000 features breathable mesh with horizontal and vertical overlays for a 2000s running look that is as striking as, say, a majestic winged horse. Drawing on the design of the Nike Pegasus 25 and 2006, its running aesthetic meets all-day comfort for the streets.

name: Nike - Nike React Element 87
description: Borrowing design lines from heritage Nike running shoes such as the Internationalist, the Nike React Element 87 Men's Shoe embraces history and pushes it into the future. Nike React foam delivers lightweight comfort, while transparent and reflective details offer a cutting-edge look that begs for a reaction.

name: Nike - Zoom Vomero 5 SE SP
description: The Nike Zoom Vomero 5 SE SP wraps your foot in breathable support. A combination of durable synthetic leather and breathable mesh stands ready for the rigours of your day. Soft foam and Zoom Air cushioning deliver lightweight comfort for a smooth ride.

name: Nike - Women´s Nike P-6000
description: A mash-up of Pegasus' past, the Nike P-6000 features breathable mesh with horizontal and vertical overlays for a 2000s running look that is as striking as, say, a majestic winged horse. Drawing on the design of the Nike Pegasus 25 and 2006, its running aesthetic meets all-day comfort for the streets.

name: Adidas - Falcon W
description: Inspired by '90s jogging gear, the Falcon offers a bold retro look with a chunky silhouette. These shoes bring nostalgic vibes with a leather upper and a big, sculpted midsole. They're cut wide for a stable feel and all-day comfort.
